subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Thursday, May 03, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

The Ticker's got the GOP debate
covered

Ten Republican Presidential
Candidates - Sam Brownback, Jim Gilmore, Rudy Giuliani, Mike
Huckabee, Duncan Hunter, John McCain, Ron Paul, Mitt Romney,
Tom Tancredo and Tommy Thompson - debate at the Ronald Reagan
Library in Simi Valley, CA, 8 pm ET.

CNN's Political
Ticker will provide constant real-time updates, campaign spin,
reaction and expert analysis beginning at 8 p.m. ET

Also, how many times will the GOP candidates invoke former
President Ronald Reagan's name at tonight's debate?  Check
CNN.com/ticker for the "Gipper Ticker!"

Today
on the Ticker

Barack Obama placed
under Secret Service protection

WASHINGTON
(CNN) -- Illinois senator and Democratic presidential candidate
Barack Obama has been placed under the protection of the U.S.
Secret Service, the agency said Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/barack-obama-placed-under-secret.html

***

Ex-Justice official praises most fired U.S.
attorneys

WASHINGTON (AP) -- The Justice
Department's former No. 2 official testified Thursday he was
unaware of plans to fire underperforming U.S. attorneys and
praised all but one of the eight who were purged last year.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/03/fired.prosecutors.ap/index.html

***

U.S. and Syria
discuss foreign fighters in Iraq

SHARM
EL-SHEIK, Egypt (AP) -- U.S. Secretary of State Condoleezza
Rice said she raised the issue of foreign fighters entering
Iraq from Syria in talks with Syria's foreign minister
Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/meast/05/03/iraq.conference.ap/index.html

***

GOP
strategist: Tonight's debate is 'batting practice'

SIMI VALLEY, California (AP) -- Ten Republicans, one
stage, 90 minutes -- just enough time for Rudy Giuliani, John
McCain or Mitt Romney to make a major gaffe as underdog rivals
scramble for relevancy during the first GOP presidential debate
Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/03/republicans.debate.ap/index.html

***

Behind Enemy
Lines

SIMI VALLEY, California (CNN) -- Among
those spotted heading to tonight's presidential debate at the
Reagan Library? DNC Communications Director Karen Finney.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/behind-enemy-lines.html

***

Florida lawmakers green-light early
primary

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Florida has taken
another step towards moving its presidential primary to its
earliest date ever with the legislature passing a bill Thursday
that would change the date to January 29, 2008.

Full
story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/florida-lawmakers-green-light-early.html

***

Edwards wants role in GOP debate

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Democratic Presidential candidate John
Edwards wants in on tonight's Republican presidential debate.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/edwards-wants-role-in-gop-debate.html

***

Romney, Leno trade jokes on "Tonight Show"

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Republican presidential hopeful
Mitt Romney likes to tout the fact that he and his wife met in
high school and the two have been married for nearly forty
years.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/romney-leno-trade-jokes-on-tonight-show.html

***

Clinton suggests presidential nominee will be
settled by early February

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
Sen. Hillary Clinton, D-New York, sent a fundraising e-mail
solicitation to supporters Thursday, telling them that the
front loaded primary schedule is likely to result in a nominee
being selected in the first week of February 2008.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/clinton-suggests-presidential-nominee.html

***

Obama calls jittery MySpace supporter

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Senator Barack Obama may have
started to smooth ruffled feathers over his campaign's decision
to take control of a MySpace page listed under his name.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-calls-jittery-myspace-supporter.html
